owned in a way that means you can own and use a building or piece of land for an unlimited time: Are those flats freehold or leasehold?
More examplesFewer examples Apart from charities, only a maximum of four people can hold the legal title to freehold or leasehold property in England.Most houses have balconies overlooking the marina or North Harbour and all are freehold.Magnificent five-storey freehold house in an elegant Georgian terrace, built circa 1830. Today freehold tenure signifies that land is held without any person interposed between the Crown and the holder.
